title: School Social Work: Theory to Practice
abstract: Introduction, Lynn Bye and Michelle Alvarez. Part One: SCHOOL SOCIAL WORK: HISTORY AND CONTEXTS. 1. History of Social Work, Gary Lee Shaffer, Ph.D. 2. School Social Work and Educational Reform, Joseph R. Gianesin, M.S.W., Ph.D. 3. Ecological Perspective for Social Work Kendra J. Garrett, D.S.W. 4. The Many Facets in the Role of a Social Worker, William C. Lee, M.S.W. Part Two: SCHOOL SOCIAL WORK: POLICY, COMMUNITY AND ORGANIZATIONAL PRACTICE. 5. School Social Work at the Policy and Level, Jan Wilson, M.S.W. 6. School Social Work at the Organizational Level, Andy Frey, M.S.W., Ph.D., Hill Walker, Ph.D. 7. Community Schools: New Roles for Social Work Practitioners, Jane Quinn, M.A. Part Three: SCHOOL SOCIAL WORK: SMALLER SYSTEMS PRACTICE. 8. School Social Work with Families, Lynn Bye, M.S.W., Ph.D. 9. School Social Work with Individuals and Small Groups, Elizabeth Tracy, M.S.W., Ph.D., Kathleen Usaj, M.S.S.A. 10. School Social Work and Crisis Intervention, Donna Secor, M.S.W. 11. Consultation in Social Work, Joseph R. Gianesin, Ph.D. Part Four: SCHOOL SOCIAL WORK: KEY ISSUES AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR PRACTICE. 12. Confidentiality in the Schools, Sandra Kopels, M.S.W., J.D 13. Incorporating Best Practices, David R. Dupper, Ph.D. 14. Research and Evaluation of Social Work Practice, Melissa Jonson-Reid, M.S.W., Ph.D. 15. Legal Issues in Social Work, Gaylon J. Nettles, M.S.W., J.D. 16. School Social Work Practice with Students with Disabilities, James P. Clark, M.S.W., Charlene Thiede, M.S.W. Part Five: SCHOOL SOCIAL WORK: EMERGING TRENDS AND LOOKING AHEAD TO THE FUTURE. 17. Technology and Social Work, Brenda Coble Lindsey, M.A., M.S.W., Margaret King White, M.S.W. 18. The Transition from Student to Social Worker, Michelle Alvarez, M.S.W., Ed.D. 19. The International Development of Social Work, Marian Huxtable, M.S.W.
